numlitem.para: One required when operating in the 50 states and District of Columbia.
One required in airspace of foreign countries which require DME.
If both distance measuring equipment systems become inoperative en route, ATC must be notified as soon as it occurs.
RNP-10 airspace operations are not authorized for flights in excess of 12 hours after alignment without updating.
BRNAV (RNP-5) airspace operations are not authorized for flights in excess of 2 hours after alignment without updating.

note.para: At least one DME system is required for all flight operations in the 50 states and the District of Columbia.

For operations to Central, South American and Mexico destinations ONLY, the flight may not depart outbound domestic gateways with inoperative Distance Measuring Equipment (DME), but may continue series of flights for repair interval specified in the Repair Int Category section.

placard.para: Placard near Left or Right RDMI "DME INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
